text:
this evening I find that Pkg is hanging on the following
```(@v1.6) pkg> up
  Installing known registries into `~/.julia`
       Added registry `General` to `~/.julia/registries/General`
    Updating registry at `~/.julia/registries/General````
not sure what's going on... not having any problems talking to github

text: What does the git repo at ~/.julia/registries/General look like ?

elements.text: What does the git repo at ~/.julia/registries/General look like ?

text: the registry repo looks fine, I even tried cloning it there myself, but it still hangs

elements.text: the registry repo looks fine, I even tried cloning it there myself, but it still hangs

text: so pkg server is down maybe?

text:
Is pkg server being down also what causes the weird errors like
```(@v1.6) pkg> up
ERROR: Unsatisfiable requirements detected for package Conda [8f4d0f93]:
 Conda [8f4d0f93] log:
 ├─Conda [8f4d0f93] has no known versions!
 └─found to have no compatible versions left with IJulia [7073ff75]
   └─IJulia [7073ff75] log:
     ├─possible versions are: 1.9.0-1.23.1 or uninstalled
     └─restricted to versions * by an explicit requirement, leaving only versions 1.9.0-1.23.1```
?

elements.text: Is pkg server being down also what causes the weird errors like

(@v1.6) pkg> up
ERROR: Unsatisfiable requirements detected for package Conda [8f4d0f93]:
 Conda [8f4d0f93] log:
 ├─Conda [8f4d0f93] has no known versions!
 └─found to have no compatible versions left with IJulia [7073ff75]
   └─IJulia [7073ff75] log:
     ├─possible versions are: 1.9.0-1.23.1 or uninstalled

text: Looks like a very outdated registry or something.

elements.text: Looks like a very outdated registry or something.

text: About two weeks ago servers were sending outdated versions of the registry. Might be the same problem again?

elements.text: About two weeks ago servers were sending outdated versions of the registry. Might be the same problem again?

text: I don't think so, must be something locally that is wrong since Conda has been in the registry forever.
